newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares up on Clinton, Yeltsin, falls ahead.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares up on Clinton, Yeltsin, falls ahead.

text.p: Danish share prices closed higher on Wednesday, boosted by Clinton's U.S. election victory, Yeltsin's successful heart surgery and bond and dollar rises, with dealers fearing modest setbacks though in the day ahead.
"The market climbed on favourable foreign news but we seemed to run out of steam a little by the end of trading, so tomorrow could see prices slipping a bit," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index finished 0.82 point higher at 127.16, while the KFX December future rose 1.20 point to 128.05 with 95 contracts each worth 100,000 crowns traded.

Tele Danmark closed seven crowns down at 292, while Novo Nordisk shot 14 crowns up to end at 984, boosted according to some dealers by the Republicans holding on to power in the U.S. Congress and receding fears of an American health sector reform.
Radiometer rose 10 crowns to 385 and SAS Danmark continued upwards, putting on 2.10 crowns to finish at 72.10.
Banks did well again too despite slipping a little in the afternoon with Den Danske ending three crowns up at 429 and rival Unidanmark two higher at 274.
Overall turnover for the day was 746 million crowns. --Chris Follett, Copenhagen newsroom, 45-33-969650
